examples.scenario: Podcast episode makes historical claims needing context

tool_sequence.reasoning: Verify factual accuracy using authoritative sources
Find related content and historical context
Identify logical errors and reasoning flaws
Present the strongest possible version of the argument
Preserve findings for future reference and learning

reasoning_steps: Define the specific information need or question
Identify the most appropriate tools for the task
Plan the sequence of tool usage for optimal results
Execute tools with careful parameter selection
Validate results and cross-check with alternative methods
Synthesize findings into coherent conclusion
Identify limitations and areas for further investigation
Consider alternative interpretations and edge cases
Evaluate potential biases in sources and methodology
Assess broader implications and downstream effects
Plan for uncertainty and incomplete information
examples.expected_outcome: Expert-level content analysis with 85% confidence, 4 cross-verified sources, full uncertainty quantification

anti_patterns.description: Getting stuck in endless verification loops
anti_patterns.why_bad: Prevents timely delivery of results

anti_patterns.description: Using tools in random order without logical progression
anti_patterns.why_bad: Later tools cannot benefit from earlier analysis, reducing effectiveness

anti_patterns.description: Accepting first source found without cross-checking
anti_patterns.why_bad: Leads to propagation of misinformation and low-quality analysis
